summary: This document is an email chain from October 31, 2019, regarding the Epstein investigation. Attorney Bruce Barket requests contact information for lawyers handling the 'Epstein/MCC' investigation from an Assistant U.S. Attorney. The forwarded message shows the initial request, and the top message indicates the recipient's intent to provide names without wanting to know details.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney at Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP who sends an email requesting the name and contact information for lawyers handling the Epstein/MCC investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Recipient of Bruce Barket's forwarded email request; the top email indicates this person will provide names related to the investigation.

connections.description: Bruce Barket, a private attorney, emails an Assistant U.S. Attorney to request contact information for lawyers involved in the Epstein/MCC investigation.

events.title: Email Request Regarding Epstein Investigation
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket emails an Assistant U.S. Attorney requesting contact information for lawyers handling the Epstein/MCC investigation.

keyFacts: Attorney Bruce Barket sought contact information for lawyers handling the 'Epstein/MCC' investigation from a federal prosecutor in October 2019.
The email chain suggests coordination or information sharing between private legal counsel and federal prosecutors regarding the Epstein case.
The term 'Epstein/MCC' investigation is referenced, potentially indicating a specific aspect or venue of the broader Epstein investigation.
The correspondence is marked as potentially confidential attorney-client communication or privileged.
The top email indicates the recipient's intent to provide names without wanting to know further details, suggesting a cautious or procedural approach.
